publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Say's my Uncle J pray you discoverWhat has been ye Cause of your Woes,
That you pine & you whine, like a Lover,J've seen Molly Mog of the Rose.2
O Nephew! yor grief is but Folly,Jn Town you may find bitter Prog,
Half a Crown there will get you a Molly,A Molly much better than Mog.3
J know that by Witts its recited, That Women at best are a Clog,
But J'm not so easily frighted,From loving of sweet Molly Mog.4
The School Boys desire is a Play Day, The School Master's Joy is to Flog,
The Milk Maids Delight is on May Day,But mine is on Sweet Molly Mog.5
Will a wisp leads ye Trav'ler a gadding,Thrô Ditch & thro' Quagmire & Bog,
But no Light can set me a madding,Like ye Eyes of my Sweet Molly Mog.6
For Guineas in other Mens Breeches, Your Gamesters will Palm & will Cog,
But J envy them none of their Riches,So J may win Sweet Molly Mog.7
The Heart when half Wounded is Changing, It here & there leaps like a Frog,
But my Heart can never be ranging,'Tis so fix't upon Sweet Molly Mog.8
who follows all Ladies of Pleasure, Jn Pleasure is thought but a Hog,
all the Sex cannot give so good Measure,Of Joys,/ as my Sweet Molly Mog.9
I feel J'm in Love to Distraction, My Senses all Lost in a Fog,
Now there's nothing can give Satisfaction,But thinking of sweet Molly Mog.10
A Letter when J am Jnditing, Comes Cupid and gives me a Jog,
And J fill all the Paper with Writing,Of Nothing but Sweet Molly Mog.11
Jf J would not give up the three Graces, J wish J were hang'd like a Dog,
And at Court all the Drawing Room Faces,For a glance of my Sweet Molly Mog.12
Those Faces wan't Nature & Spirit, And seem as Cut out of a Log,
Juno, Venus, & Pallas's Merit,Unites in my Sweet Molly Mog.13
Those who Toast all the Family royal, Jn Bumpers of Hogan & Nog,
Have Hearts not more true or more Loyal,Than mine to my Sweet Molly Mog.14
Were Virgil alive with his Phillis, And Writing another Ec──logue,
Both his Phillis & fair Amaryllis,He'd give up for my Sweet Molly Mog.15
When She Smiles on Each Guest, like her Liquor, Then Jealousie sets me agog,
To be sure she's a Bit for the Vicar,And so J shall Loose Molly Mog.Y29-419B
